DOC.detailed_description: Smith-Lemli-Opitz syndrome ( SLOS , RSH , OMIM # 270400 ) autosomal recessive , multiple malformation , mental retardation syndrome due inborn error cholesterol biosynthesis . Specifically , patient deficiency 3 beta-hydroxysterol Delta 7-reductase activity due mutation 3 beta-hydroxysterol delta 7-reductase gene ( DHCR7 ) . This enzymatic deficiency impairs conversion 7-dehydrocholesterol ( 7-DHC ) cholesterol last step cholesterol biosynthesis via Kandutch-Russel biosynthetic pathway . The clinical manifestation SLOS extremely variable phenotypic spectrum broad . At severe end spectrum SLOS lethal disorder multiple major congenital anomaly , mild case SLOS combine minor physical stigma behavioral learn disability . Based clinical study , incidence SLOS order 1/10,000 1/60,000 . Molecular study show carrier frequency 1 % common SLOS mutant allele North American population . Currently therapy base dietary cholesterol supplementation . Although clinical improvement note , serum cholesterol level rarely normalize elevate serum 7-DHC level persist . Because elevated 7-DHC level may toxic effect , treatment SLOS patient HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor propose . Two small ( two-patient ) open trial simvastatin therapy SLOS report . One trial show improved clinical status , decrease 7-DHC level increase cholesterol level . The second trial show decreased 7-DHC level ; however , treatment discontinue one patient preexist liver disease .
